IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Evaluation of Autologous Mesenchymal Stem Cell Transplantation in Chronic Spinal Cord Injury: a Pilot Study

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: The purpose of this study is to analyze the safety and efficacy of mesenchymal stem cell transplantation through percutaneous injection in patients with chronic spinal cord injury.

Intervention.InterventionDescription: Mesenchymal stem cell transplantation through percutaneous injection.

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: After the transplantation of the cells, patients will be followed up by clinical examinations and will perform laboratorial and radiological exams, in order to search for complications of the procedure.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Sensitivity and motor strength on the inferior limbs
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: AIS (ASIA Improvement Scale) degree on the ASIA score will be assessed in order to evaluate sensitivity and motor strength on the inferior limbs.
The patients will undergo urodynamic study to evaluate urological improvements.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Improvements in sensorial mapping and neuropathic pain
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: The patients will be submitted to specific questionnaires and clinical examinations in order to evaluate improvements in sensorial mapping and neuropathic pain.

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Closed spinal cord injury at thoracic or thoracolumbar level bellow T8, or open spinal cord injury, at the same level, provided that the mechanism of the lesion is a spinal shock, ischemia or hematoma
ASIA class A
Signing the written consent

Exclusion Criteria:

Anatomical transection of the spinal cord
Spinal cord lesion by sharp objects
Ongoing infections
Terminal, neurodegenerative or primary hematological diseases
Osteopathies which determine a higher risc to the bone marrow puncture
Coagulopathies
Severe hepatic, renal or heart failure
Pregnancy or lactation
Clinical conditions that hinder the percutaneous injection of the cells such as arthrodesis
Use of metallic implants near vascular structures (such as cardiac pacemaker or aortic prosthesis) which won't allow patients to perform MRI
Participation in other clinical trial

OverallOfficial.OverallOfficialName: Ricardo R dos Santos, MD, PhD
